content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Federation Star Base 27, constructed near the Klingon border, assumes operational status.

gsx$event.$t: Federation Star Base 27, constructed near the Klingon border, assumes operational status.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Starfleet Intelligence later learns that the Klingon naval base at Mastocal has been completed. This base is located very close to Federation space, in an area of Klingon territory gained as a result of the Four Years War.

gsx$event.$t: Starfleet Intelligence later learns that the Klingon naval base at Mastocal has been completed. This base is located very close to Federation space, in an area of Klingon territory gained as a result of the Four Years War.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: A Starfleet task force consisting of five Larson Class destroyers enters an uncontrolled area of space near the Romulan Neutral Zone. After one month, the task force fails to report back at its scheduled time. A rescue group finds a single warp engine nacelle in an asteroid cluster, but no additional evidence. Romulans are suspected, but nothing is ever proved.

gsx$event.$t: A Starfleet task force consisting of five Larson Class destroyers enters an uncontrolled area of space near the Romulan Neutral Zone. After one month, the task force fails to report back at its scheduled time. A rescue group finds a single warp engine nacelle in an asteroid cluster, but no additional evidence. Romulans are suspected, but nothing is ever proved.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Star's End settlement is colonized with the assistance of 42 Cochrane Class colonial transports. This forms the largest colonial convoy to date.

gsx$event.$t: The Star's End settlement is colonized with the assistance of 42 Cochrane Class colonial transports. This forms the largest colonial convoy to date.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Federation and Klingon forces clash along a wide expanse of space claimed by both sides.

gsx$event.$t: Federation and Klingon forces clash along a wide expanse of space claimed by both sides.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Kobax VI crisis occurs when a usurper assassinates the president of Kobax VI, a Federation world near the Klingon Empire, and declares the planet independent of the UFP. After the assassin is uncovered as a Klingon agent, two regiments of Starfleet Marines restore order on the planet and deter a Klingon invasion.

gsx$event.$t: The Kobax VI crisis occurs when a usurper assassinates the president of Kobax VI, a Federation world near the Klingon Empire, and declares the planet independent of the UFP. After the assassin is uncovered as a Klingon agent, two regiments of Starfleet Marines restore order on the planet and deter a Klingon invasion.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Armed conflict erupts between the Klingon Empire and the United Federation of Planets. Both sides suffer heavy casualties and prepare for full-scale war.

gsx$event.$t: Armed conflict erupts between the Klingon Empire and the United Federation of Planets. Both sides suffer heavy casualties and prepare for full-scale war.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Starfleet Intelligence later learns that Klingon Thought Admiral Krador zantai Rrilac is reassigned to a military governorship on Muldor IV.

gsx$event.$t: Starfleet Intelligence later learns that Klingon Thought Admiral Krador zantai Rrilac is reassigned to a military governorship on Muldor IV.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Derf Class tender USS Acropolis responds to a malfunctioning navigational marker buoy. A Klingon warship attacks, cripples the Acropolis, and tows it into Klingon space. Starfleet Intelligence later learns that the Klingons tampered with the buoy, producing the false signal.

gsx$event.$t: The Derf Class tender USS Acropolis responds to a malfunctioning navigational marker buoy. A Klingon warship attacks, cripples the Acropolis, and tows it into Klingon space. Starfleet Intelligence later learns that the Klingons tampered with the buoy, producing the false signal.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: As a result of the danger posed by the new Klingon base at Mastocal, Federation Star Base 12 is completed and assumes operational status.

gsx$event.$t: As a result of the danger posed by the new Klingon base at Mastocal, Federation Star Base 12 is completed and assumes operational status.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The USS Enterprise discovers the DY-100 Class explorer/sleeper ship SS Botany Bay, carrying cryogenically preserved survivors of the Eugenics Wars. Seventy genetically enhanced supermen are revived and brought aboard the Enterprise. Khan Noonian Singh, the groups leader and infamous tyrant, takes temporary control of the starship, but Captain Kirk and his crew re-establish order. Khan, his group, and Starfleet Lieutenant Marla McGivers (guilty of collusion in Khans hijacking attempt) are left on Ceti Alpha V to colonize the planet, in lieu of court-martial or formal rehabilitation.

gsx$event.$t: The USS Enterprise discovers the DY-100 Class explorer/sleeper ship SS Botany Bay, carrying cryogenically preserved survivors of the Eugenics Wars. Seventy genetically enhanced supermen are revived and brought aboard the Enterprise. Khan Noonian Singh, the groups leader and infamous tyrant, takes temporary control of the starship, but Captain Kirk and his crew re-establish order. Khan, his group, and Starfleet Lieutenant Marla McGivers (guilty of collusion in Khans hijacking attempt) are left on Ceti Alpha V to colonize the planet, in lieu of court-martial or formal rehabilitation.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Representatives from the Federation and the Klingon Empire fail to reach a peaceful resolution of their differences. Warships from the Klingon Empire invade space claimed by the Federation.

gsx$event.$t: Representatives from the Federation and the Klingon Empire fail to reach a peaceful resolution of their differences. Warships from the Klingon Empire invade space claimed by the Federation.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: A Klingon battle group under the command of Captain Kor seizes the planet of Organia and transports occupation forces to the planets surface.

gsx$event.$t: A Klingon battle group under the command of Captain Kor seizes the planet of Organia and transports occupation forces to the planets surface.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The USS Enterprise responds to Organia. Captain Kirk and his First Officer are captured after attacking Klingon military installations on Organia.

gsx$event.$t: The USS Enterprise responds to Organia. Captain Kirk and his First Officer are captured after attacking Klingon military installations on Organia.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The USS Enterprise makes first Federation contact with the Gorn Alliance. The vessel encounters an MA-12 Class cruiser commanded by Gorn Captain Sslee after that vessel destroyed the Federation outpost on Cestus III.

gsx$event.$t: The USS Enterprise makes first Federation contact with the Gorn Alliance. The vessel encounters an MA-12 Class cruiser commanded by Gorn Captain Sslee after that vessel destroyed the Federation outpost on Cestus III.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The brief Federation/Klingon war, the imposed Organian peace, and first contact with the Gorn the Federation Council's final action on the Romulan border attack and the theorized Romulan/Vulcan link. Though Starfleet doubles the number of patrols along the Romulan Neutral Zone and establishes new, larger, more heavily armed border stations, no direct action is taken against the Romulans at this time.

gsx$event.$t: The brief Federation/Klingon war, the imposed Organian peace, and first contact with the Gorn the Federation Council's final action on the Romulan border attack and the theorized Romulan/Vulcan link. Though Starfleet doubles the number of patrols along the Romulan Neutral Zone and establishes new, larger, more heavily armed border stations, no direct action is taken against the Romulans at this time.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Constitution Class cruiser USS Constellation (NCC 1017), under the command of Commodore Matthew Brand Decker, is severely damaged by a Doomsday Machine. The vessel's entire crew, except Decker, is killed in a related mishap. In a tactic later known as the Kirk Defense, the USS Enterprise crew destroys the Doomsday Machine by setting the Constellation's engines for self-destruct and exploding the starship inside the machine. Before the operation is completed, Decker also becomes a casualty.

gsx$event.$t: The Constitution Class cruiser USS Constellation (NCC 1017), under the command of Commodore Matthew Brand Decker, is severely damaged by a Doomsday Machine. The vessel's entire crew, except Decker, is killed in a related mishap. In a tactic later known as the Kirk Defense, the USS Enterprise crew destroys the Doomsday Machine by setting the Constellation's engines for self-destruct and exploding the starship inside the machine. Before the operation is completed, Decker also becomes a casualty.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: As the result of tectonic instability, Ceti Alpha VI, a planet-sized moon in coorbit with Ceti Alpha V, explodes. The effect alters Ceti Alpha V's orbit slightly and transforms it from a luxurious garden world into an inhospitable desert.

gsx$event.$t: As the result of tectonic instability, Ceti Alpha VI, a planet-sized moon in coorbit with Ceti Alpha V, explodes. The effect alters Ceti Alpha V's orbit slightly and transforms it from a luxurious garden world into an inhospitable desert.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Constitution Class cruiser USS Republic (NCC 1373), under command of Captain Richard V. Masterson, is officially listed as missing. Based on information obtained at the time, Starfleet officials believe that the vessel may have been missing as much as seven months prior.

gsx$event.$t: The Constitution Class cruiser USS Republic (NCC 1373), under command of Captain Richard V. Masterson, is officially listed as missing. Based on information obtained at the time, Starfleet officials believe that the vessel may have been missing as much as seven months prior.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Nelson Class scout USS Menke, operating along the rimward frontier, is listed as missing after failing to make a scheduled report. The Nelson Class scout USS Stuart conducts a twomonth-long search without success.

gsx$event.$t: The Nelson Class scout USS Menke, operating along the rimward frontier, is listed as missing after failing to make a scheduled report. The Nelson Class scout USS Stuart conducts a twomonth-long search without success.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: A convoy consisting of six Cochrane Class colonial transports plus escorts is listed as missing after failing to arrive at its destination of New Deimos. Some believe the Gorn Alliance may have been responsible, but no evidence supports this allegation.

gsx$event.$t: A convoy consisting of six Cochrane Class colonial transports plus escorts is listed as missing after failing to arrive at its destination of New Deimos. Some believe the Gorn Alliance may have been responsible, but no evidence supports this allegation.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Lieutenant Commander Willard Decker, a Helmsman/Weapons Officer, receives a short-term shore assignment on Delta IV.

gsx$event.$t: Lieutenant Commander Willard Decker, a Helmsman/Weapons Officer, receives a short-term shore assignment on Delta IV.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Vulcan Science Academy sends a report on psionic contact with a new race of beings, the Tholians, to the Bureau of Scientific Investigation, where it is forgotten.

gsx$event.$t: The Vulcan Science Academy sends a report on psionic contact with a new race of beings, the Tholians, to the Bureau of Scientific Investigation, where it is forgotten.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Starfleet Intelligence Command later learns that the Nelson Class scout USS Valdez, captured by the Klingons during the Four Years War, was destroyed during this time. The Klingons had been using the Valdez along the coreward border at the time of its destruction.

gsx$event.$t: Starfleet Intelligence Command later learns that the Nelson Class scout USS Valdez, captured by the Klingons during the Four Years War, was destroyed during this time. The Klingons had been using the Valdez along the coreward border at the time of its destruction.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Starfleet Intelligence later confirms that, at this time, the Romulan Imperial Navy began using three-ship squadrons of Klingon-built Stormbird Class cruisers along their side of the Neutral Zone.

gsx$event.$t: Starfleet Intelligence later confirms that, at this time, the Romulan Imperial Navy began using three-ship squadrons of Klingon-built Stormbird Class cruisers along their side of the Neutral Zone.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The world of Penchan II becomes the fourth member of the Imperial Klingon States within the Triangle. Penchan is vital to the future existence of the IKS because of its vast crystal deposits (including dilithium). With these and other metals, the IKS can begin rebuilding its worn-out fleet.

gsx$event.$t: The world of Penchan II becomes the fourth member of the Imperial Klingon States within the Triangle. Penchan is vital to the future existence of the IKS because of its vast crystal deposits (including dilithium). With these and other metals, the IKS can begin rebuilding its worn-out fleet.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The USS Enterprise makes first contact with the Tholian Assembly. The Starfleet vessel encounters Spinner Class starships under Tholian CommanderLoskene while responding to a distress call from ther Constitution Class cruiser USS Defiant.

gsx$event.$t: The USS Enterprise makes first contact with the Tholian Assembly. The Starfleet vessel encounters Spinner Class starships under Tholian CommanderLoskene while responding to a distress call from ther Constitution Class cruiser USS Defiant.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The first outbreak of Orion blood fever takes place among the inhabitants of Rigel VII. Starfleet Intelligence later learns that the disease depopulated several Klingon settlements before quarantines were ordered.

gsx$event.$t: The first outbreak of Orion blood fever takes place among the inhabitants of Rigel VII. Starfleet Intelligence later learns that the disease depopulated several Klingon settlements before quarantines were ordered.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The USS Enterprise begins its scheduled overhaul at the Sol III shipyard. This leads to one of the most interesting starship conversion/modifications in recent history. When the work is completed in Stardate 2/1704, the vessel becomes the most powerful in known space.

gsx$event.$t: The USS Enterprise begins its scheduled overhaul at the Sol III shipyard. This leads to one of the most interesting starship conversion/modifications in recent history. When the work is completed in Stardate 2/1704, the vessel becomes the most powerful in known space.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Aakenn Class freighter USS Mundy is found adrift with life support systems operating but without a crew. Millions of live tribbles are found in the vessels cargo hold, surviving on the food produced by a stillifunctional food synthesizer. Almost nine years later, two Mundy crewmembers are found, and they relate how renegade Klingons boarded the vessel, discovered the cargo of tribbles, and killed or abandoned the entire crew.

gsx$event.$t: The Aakenn Class freighter USS Mundy is found adrift with life support systems operating but without a crew. Millions of live tribbles are found in the vessels cargo hold, surviving on the food produced by a stillifunctional food synthesizer. Almost nine years later, two Mundy crewmembers are found, and they relate how renegade Klingons boarded the vessel, discovered the cargo of tribbles, and killed or abandoned the entire crew.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Starfleet Intelligence later learns that a Klingon task force engaged a Romulan task force near the Triangle. This skirmish, involving a total of eleven starships, demonstrates the flaws in the newly designed Klingon L-13 Class battleship.

gsx$event.$t: Starfleet Intelligence later learns that a Klingon task force engaged a Romulan task force near the Triangle. This skirmish, involving a total of eleven starships, demonstrates the flaws in the newly designed Klingon L-13 Class battleship.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Commander Montgomery Scott is reassigned to help refit the USS Enterprise.

gsx$event.$t: Commander Montgomery Scott is reassigned to help refit the USS Enterprise.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: An R-1 Type Orbital Research Outpost is towed to Regula, a Class D planet. The station is designated as the Regula I Research Station.

gsx$event.$t: An R-1 Type Orbital Research Outpost is towed to Regula, a Class D planet. The station is designated as the Regula I Research Station.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Initial plans regarding Operation Dixie, a deep-probe intelligence and reconnaissance mission into Imperial Klingon space, are filed with Admiral Nogura, Chief of Starfleet Operations. Nogura approves the tentative proposal and sets the start date at 2/1901.

gsx$event.$t: Initial plans regarding Operation Dixie, a deep-probe intelligence and reconnaissance mission into Imperial Klingon space, are filed with Admiral Nogura, Chief of Starfleet Operations. Nogura approves the tentative proposal and sets the start date at 2/1901.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Anton Class cruiser USS Reliant (NCC-1864) is brought into a shipyard at Morena. The vessel is extensively modified, becoming the class vessel for the Reliant Class, just as the Enterprise Class evolved from the Constitution Class.

gsx$event.$t: The Anton Class cruiser USS Reliant (NCC-1864) is brought into a shipyard at Morena. The vessel is extensively modified, becoming the class vessel for the Reliant Class, just as the Enterprise Class evolved from the Constitution Class.

content.$t: stardateend: 2/2300.00, full: TRUE, event: Starfleet and commercial starship losses gradually increase in the region of space near Star Base 27. No clear cause is identified.

gsx$event.$t: Starfleet and commercial starship losses gradually increase in the region of space near Star Base 27. No clear cause is identified.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Federation Ambassador Helen Jarvis, kidnapped by Orion terrorists, is freed by agents of the Starfleet Intelligence Command.

gsx$event.$t: Federation Ambassador Helen Jarvis, kidnapped by Orion terrorists, is freed by agents of the Starfleet Intelligence Command.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The three Operation Dixie ships, the Dixie Queen, the Dixie Lady, and the Dixie Princess, depart on their planned five-year mission nearly two years ahead of the original Scheduled start date.

gsx$event.$t: The three Operation Dixie ships, the Dixie Queen, the Dixie Lady, and the Dixie Princess, depart on their planned five-year mission nearly two years ahead of the original Scheduled start date.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Launched from Federation Sensor Outpost Epsilon Nine, a remote-controlled sensor drone detects a strange electrical cloud near the Klingon base of Mera Zine. Three Klingon D-7M Class cruisers attack the cloud and are instantly vaporized, proving the object is capable of incredible destruction.

gsx$event.$t: Launched from Federation Sensor Outpost Epsilon Nine, a remote-controlled sensor drone detects a strange electrical cloud near the Klingon base of Mera Zine. Three Klingon D-7M Class cruisers attack the cloud and are instantly vaporized, proving the object is capable of incredible destruction.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Epsilon Nine station is vaporized by the electrical cloud, which heads toward Terra. Until it is destroyed, the station continues transmitting a live video signal to Starfleet Command via subspace radio.

gsx$event.$t: The Epsilon Nine station is vaporized by the electrical cloud, which heads toward Terra. Until it is destroyed, the station continues transmitting a live video signal to Starfleet Command via subspace radio.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: While on Vulcan, Commander Spock detects powerful thought emanations coming from the electrical cloud. He travels to Terra.

gsx$event.$t: While on Vulcan, Commander Spock detects powerful thought emanations coming from the electrical cloud. He travels to Terra.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Admiral Kirk is informed of the cloud's movement. After meeting with Starfleet Admiral Heihachiro Nogura, Kirk immediately takes over command of the Enterprise, demoting Decker to First Officer.

gsx$event.$t: Admiral Kirk is informed of the cloud's movement. After meeting with Starfleet Admiral Heihachiro Nogura, Kirk immediately takes over command of the Enterprise, demoting Decker to First Officer.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The crew of the USS Enterprise watches a live, but delayed, report showing the destruction of Epsilon Nine.

gsx$event.$t: The crew of the USS Enterprise watches a live, but delayed, report showing the destruction of Epsilon Nine.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Spock arrives from Vulcan, rejoining the Enterprise as Chief Science Officer.

gsx$event.$t: Spock arrives from Vulcan, rejoining the Enterprise as Chief Science Officer.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Spock arrives from Vulcan, rejoining the Enterprise as Chief Science Officer.

gsx$event.$t: Spock arrives from Vulcan, rejoining the Enterprise as Chief Science Officer.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Enterprise is dispatched to intercept the cloud. The crew discovers that the cloud is a huge vessel, the heart of which contains V'ger, the Voyager I probe presumably lost in a black hole. After the incident, Decker and Lieutenant Ilia of Delta IV are listed as missing in action.

gsx$event.$t: The Enterprise is dispatched to intercept the cloud. The crew discovers that the cloud is a huge vessel, the heart of which contains V'ger, the Voyager I probe presumably lost in a black hole. After the incident, Decker and Lieutenant Ilia of Delta IV are listed as missing in action.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The christening of the Enterprise Class heavy cruiser takes place after the mission is completed.

gsx$event.$t: The christening of the Enterprise Class heavy cruiser takes place after the mission is completed.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The christening of the Enterprise Class heavy cruiser takes place after the mission is completed.

gsx$event.$t: The christening of the Enterprise Class heavy cruiser takes place after the mission is completed.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The V'ger incident enhances Kirks fame, and makes him too valuable to risk in active command. After a short shakedown cruise of the new Enterprise, Kirk returns to desk duty and is eventually assigned to testing and inspection on detached service from Starfleet Academy. Commander Spock's reserve commission is reactivated; he stays on with a promotion as Captain of the Enterprise.

gsx$event.$t: The V'ger incident enhances Kirks fame, and makes him too valuable to risk in active command. After a short shakedown cruise of the new Enterprise, Kirk returns to desk duty and is eventually assigned to testing and inspection on detached service from Starfleet Academy. Commander Spock's reserve commission is reactivated; he stays on with a promotion as Captain of the Enterprise.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The V'ger incident enhances Kirks fame, and makes him too valuable to risk in active command. After a short shakedown cruise of the new Enterprise, Kirk returns to desk duty and is eventually assigned to testing and inspection on detached service from Starfleet Academy. Commander Spock's reserve commission is reactivated; he stays on with a promotion as Captain of the Enterprise.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: 17#Sunset

gsx$event.$t: 17#Sunset

content.$t: full: TRUE
full: TRUE, event: Starfleet begins receiving disquieting intelligence reports concerning the Organians.

gsx$event.$t: Starfleet begins receiving disquieting intelligence reports concerning the Organians.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Reliant Class-research, cruiser USS Regulator (NCC-26254) is listed as missing in action after being dispatched in 2/1707 to search for the USS Triumph.

gsx$event.$t: The Reliant Class-research, cruiser USS Regulator (NCC-26254) is listed as missing in action after being dispatched in 2/1707 to search for the USS Triumph.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Admiral Kirk prepares a memo outlining and authorizing Operation Armageddon, a massive Starfleet Training Command computer simulation to be used as a training exercise in lieu of field maneuvers.

gsx$event.$t: Admiral Kirk prepares a memo outlining and authorizing Operation Armageddon, a massive Starfleet Training Command computer simulation to be used as a training exercise in lieu of field maneuvers.

content.$t: stardateend: 2/1807.00, full: TRUE, event: Although Operation Armageddon receives a go-ahead, programming efforts are hampered by a lack of hard data on Klingon and Romulan activities.

gsx$event.$t: Although Operation Armageddon receives a go-ahead, programming efforts are hampered by a lack of hard data on Klingon and Romulan activities.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Romulan Imperial Navy begins deploying Winged Defender Class heavy cruisers along the Neutral Zone.

gsx$event.$t: The Romulan Imperial Navy begins deploying Winged Defender Class heavy cruisers along the Neutral Zone.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Constitution Class cruiser USS Kongo (NCC 1710), under the command of Captain J.C. Fredriksen, and the Loknar Class Frigates USS Halk (NCC-2742) and USS Rome (NCC-2726) respond to a distress signal from a Federation outpost in the Orion sector. The outpost is under attack by a group of six Klingon D-18B Class destroyers commanded by Captain Kresz sutai-Kargon. When the conflict is over, the Federation outpost and all three Starfleet vessels are destroyed. The Klingons lose only two destroyers.

gsx$event.$t: The Constitution Class cruiser USS Kongo (NCC 1710), under the command of Captain J.C. Fredriksen, and the Loknar Class Frigates USS Halk (NCC-2742) and USS Rome (NCC-2726) respond to a distress signal from a Federation outpost in the Orion sector. The outpost is under attack by a group of six Klingon D-18B Class destroyers commanded by Captain Kresz sutai-Kargon. When the conflict is over, the Federation outpost and all three Starfleet vessels are destroyed. The Klingons lose only two destroyers.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Chandley Class frigate USS Hanson (NCC 2309), operating near the Gorn border, encounters two Gorn cruisers boarding a Liberty Class freighter. The Hanson engages the Gorn, and then Starfleet Marines board vessels for the first time in history.

gsx$event.$t: The Chandley Class frigate USS Hanson (NCC 2309), operating near the Gorn border, encounters two Gorn cruisers boarding a Liberty Class freighter. The Hanson engages the Gorn, and then Starfleet Marines board vessels for the first time in history.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Starfleet Intelligence later learns that several Romulan S-11 Class scouts were delivered to the Klingon Empire as part of a technological exchange treaty. This vessel, reequipped with Klingon shipboard systems, becomes the K-22A Bird of Prey Class scout.

gsx$event.$t: Starfleet Intelligence later learns that several Romulan S-11 Class scouts were delivered to the Klingon Empire as part of a technological exchange treaty. This vessel, reequipped with Klingon shipboard systems, becomes the K-22A Bird of Prey Class scout.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: All search efforts made to locate the USS Triumph and USS Regulator are recalled.

gsx$event.$t: All search efforts made to locate the USS Triumph and USS Regulator are recalled.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Operation Dixie begins to show significant results, as limited information on Klingon starships and ship-building is relayed back to the Federation. All data from Operation Dixie is immediately added to the Operation Armageddon simulation.

gsx$event.$t: Operation Dixie begins to show significant results, as limited information on Klingon starships and ship-building is relayed back to the Federation. All data from Operation Dixie is immediately added to the Operation Armageddon simulation.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Klingons occupy Marram IX, a world within the Triangle, though Klingon Sector Intelligence does not realize this until Stardate 2/1906.

gsx$event.$t: Klingons occupy Marram IX, a world within the Triangle, though Klingon Sector Intelligence does not realize this until Stardate 2/1906.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Representatives from the Federation and the Romulan Empire sign the Treaty of Ectair. Romulans now have free access to any non-Federation planet along the frontier, provided that they do not cross the Neutral Zone or approach within five light-years of any UFP world.

gsx$event.$t: Representatives from the Federation and the Romulan Empire sign the Treaty of Ectair. Romulans now have free access to any non-Federation planet along the frontier, provided that they do not cross the Neutral Zone or approach within five light-years of any UFP world.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Admiral zantai Kaneida's search-and-destroy mission within the Triangle begins at this time, though Starfleet does not learn of it until later. A group of Klingon warships, including a large number of K-4 Class gunboats, use combined-ship tactics to destroy or capture any Romulan Vessels encountered.

gsx$event.$t: Admiral zantai Kaneida's search-and-destroy mission within the Triangle begins at this time, though Starfleet does not learn of it until later. A group of Klingon warships, including a large number of K-4 Class gunboats, use combined-ship tactics to destroy or capture any Romulan Vessels encountered.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: After months of cautious negotiations, representatives of the UFP and the Gorn Alliance sign the Frontier Accord, limiting military activity in the disputed area. Peace talks continue on Clanhaven.

gsx$event.$t: After months of cautious negotiations, representatives of the UFP and the Gorn Alliance sign the Frontier Accord, limiting military activity in the disputed area. Peace talks continue on Clanhaven.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Select Starfleet vessels participate in Operation Solar Wind IV, a fleet-level training operation. This maneuver is designed to test Starfleet's ability to respond and repulse an invasion by Romulan forces.

gsx$event.$t: Select Starfleet vessels participate in Operation Solar Wind IV, a fleet-level training operation. This maneuver is designed to test Starfleet's ability to respond and repulse an invasion by Romulan forces.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The actual results of Operation Solar Wind IV are compared to the projected results according to Operation Armageddon. The comparison proves that the training simulation will be effective, provided accurate data is used.

gsx$event.$t: The actual results of Operation Solar Wind IV are compared to the projected results according to Operation Armageddon. The comparison proves that the training simulation will be effective, provided accurate data is used.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Dixie Queen is destroyed within Klingon space.

gsx$event.$t: The Dixie Queen is destroyed within Klingon space.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Chandley Class frigate USS Monson (NCC 2392), within the Triangle, encounters four Klingon K-23 Class destroyers. Combat ensues, and one destroyer is severely damaged. The other Klingon vessels depart, eaving behind the crippled ship, which then self-destructs.

gsx$event.$t: The Chandley Class frigate USS Monson (NCC 2392), within the Triangle, encounters four Klingon K-23 Class destroyers. Combat ensues, and one destroyer is severely damaged. The other Klingon vessels depart, eaving behind the crippled ship, which then self-destructs.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: While escorting a convoy of neutronic fuel carriers, the Genser Class escort USS Genser makes sensor contact with a small object of unknown origin. When the Genser breaks off to investigate, the entire starship disappears. Minutes later, the vessel reappears, minus its entire crew. The unknown object has not been detected since, and the whereabouts of that crew is unknown. The USS Genser remains on active duty.

gsx$event.$t: While escorting a convoy of neutronic fuel carriers, the Genser Class escort USS Genser makes sensor contact with a small object of unknown origin. When the Genser breaks off to investigate, the entire starship disappears. Minutes later, the vessel reappears, minus its entire crew. The unknown object has not been detected since, and the whereabouts of that crew is unknown. The USS Genser remains on active duty.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Agents of Starfleet Intelligence Command discover and destroy a small, mobile Klingon base, inside Federation space near Star Base 21.

gsx$event.$t: Agents of Starfleet Intelligence Command discover and destroy a small, mobile Klingon base, inside Federation space near Star Base 21.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Project Genesis receives preliminary support from Starfleet Command. Funds are provided for the projects first stage, and the entire Regula I Research Station is turned over to the project. Doctors Carol and David Marcus, co-designers of Genesis, become Project and Assistant Project Directors, respectively. Although this major research assignment is under control of Starfleet's Office of Research and Exploration, substantial funds are also obtained from Starfleet Intelligence Command.

gsx$event.$t: Project Genesis receives preliminary support from Starfleet Command. Funds are provided for the projects first stage, and the entire Regula I Research Station is turned over to the project. Doctors Carol and David Marcus, co-designers of Genesis, become Project and Assistant Project Directors, respectively. Although this major research assignment is under control of Starfleet's Office of Research and Exploration, substantial funds are also obtained from Starfleet Intelligence Command.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Klingon Empire invades Mrzicann, a small world outside the Organian Treaty Zone. The attack takes place so quickly that defenders have no chance to repel the assault. Starfleet Intelligence places greater emphasis on monitoring Klingon assault ships capable of such invasions.

gsx$event.$t: The Klingon Empire invades Mrzicann, a small world outside the Organian Treaty Zone. The attack takes place so quickly that defenders have no chance to repel the assault. Starfleet Intelligence places greater emphasis on monitoring Klingon assault ships capable of such invasions.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Starfleet Intelligence's plan to assist Human colonists on Marram IX, now under Klingon domination, is approved. The plan is codenamed Project Minuteman.

gsx$event.$t: Starfleet Intelligence's plan to assist Human colonists on Marram IX, now under Klingon domination, is approved. The plan is codenamed Project Minuteman.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Chandley Class frigate USS Blackheart (NCC-2327), patrolling the rimward frontier, is reported missing. A communications buoy is later recovered, describing the presence of a small object paralleling the Blackhearts course. There is no verified correlation between this vessel's disappearance and that of the USS Genser several months earlier.

gsx$event.$t: The Chandley Class frigate USS Blackheart (NCC-2327), patrolling the rimward frontier, is reported missing. A communications buoy is later recovered, describing the presence of a small object paralleling the Blackhearts course. There is no verified correlation between this vessel's disappearance and that of the USS Genser several months earlier.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Reliant Class research cruiser USS Invicta (NCC 26246) and the Constitution Class cruiser USS Hornet (NCC 1778) locate hull and engine components from the USS Menke 280 parsecs away from the Menkes lastknown position eleven years ago. Scientists are still baffled.

gsx$event.$t: The Reliant Class research cruiser USS Invicta (NCC 26246) and the Constitution Class cruiser USS Hornet (NCC 1778) locate hull and engine components from the USS Menke 280 parsecs away from the Menkes lastknown position eleven years ago. Scientists are still baffled.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Admiral Kaneida's Triangle mission is completed, and Starfleet Intelligence believes it to be a great success for the Klingon Empire.

gsx$event.$t: Admiral Kaneida's Triangle mission is completed, and Starfleet Intelligence believes it to be a great success for the Klingon Empire.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Wilkerson Class destroyeгs USS Carmichael and USS Henley collide during a docking operation, destroying both vessels and the docking bay facility and killing 730 personnel. An investigation reveals that a faulty tractor beam guidance control was the cause.

gsx$event.$t: The Wilkerson Class destroyeгs USS Carmichael and USS Henley collide during a docking operation, destroying both vessels and the docking bay facility and killing 730 personnel. An investigation reveals that a faulty tractor beam guidance control was the cause.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The BioResearch Corporation begins efforts to recove deposits of corboryte, a valuable metal used for starship hull manufacture, from the Polin system within the Triangle.

gsx$event.$t: The BioResearch Corporation begins efforts to recove deposits of corboryte, a valuable metal used for starship hull manufacture, from the Polin system within the Triangle.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Using Starfleet Intelligence reports as proof, Admiral Josef Cookston, Chief of Starfleet's Military Operations Command, warns the Federation Military Appropriations Committee that the Klingon Empire may have plans to begin a war with the Federation in the next five to ten years.

gsx$event.$t: Using Starfleet Intelligence reports as proof, Admiral Josef Cookston, Chief of Starfleet's Military Operations Command, warns the Federation Military Appropriations Committee that the Klingon Empire may have plans to begin a war with the Federation in the next five to ten years.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Doctor Carol Marcus receives appropriations from Starfleet Command to begin the second stage of Project Genesis.

gsx$event.$t: Doctor Carol Marcus receives appropriations from Starfleet Command to begin the second stage of Project Genesis.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Baker Class destroyer USS Cooper (NCC-4791), commanded by Commodore William P. Masefield, receives a call for assistance from Rho Markessis VI. Several Crew-members land on the planet, only to become involved in a civil war. The crew suffers casualties as they attempt to escape while preserving General Order Number One.

gsx$event.$t: The Baker Class destroyer USS Cooper (NCC-4791), commanded by Commodore William P. Masefield, receives a call for assistance from Rho Markessis VI. Several Crew-members land on the planet, only to become involved in a civil war. The crew suffers casualties as they attempt to escape while preserving General Order Number One.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Dixie Princess is destroyed within Klingon space. Project Minuteman begins.

gsx$event.$t: The Dixie Princess is destroyed within Klingon space. Project Minuteman begins.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The USS Cooper is ordered to respond to Arcanis IV, a research station near the Organian Neutral Zone.

gsx$event.$t: The USS Cooper is ordered to respond to Arcanis IV, a research station near the Organian Neutral Zone.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Starfleet Corps of Engineers (a department within the Starfleet Engineering Command) begins constructing a complex subsurface facility on Regula for Stage Two of the Genesis Project.

gsx$event.$t: The Starfleet Corps of Engineers (a department within the Starfleet Engineering Command) begins constructing a complex subsurface facility on Regula for Stage Two of the Genesis Project.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: A new Orion company called Crescent and Trefoil Developments is rumored to be manufacturing non-Federation designed electronic components.

gsx$event.$t: A new Orion company called Crescent and Trefoil Developments is rumored to be manufacturing non-Federation designed electronic components.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Starfleet Intelligence later calculates that Klingon Captain Kruge took his K-22B Bird of Prey Class Scout into Federation space at this time. Presumably, Kruge learned about Project Genesis before entering Federation Space. There may be a connection between Kruge's mission and the disappearance of a deep-space freighter, also taking place at this time.

gsx$event.$t: Starfleet Intelligence later calculates that Klingon Captain Kruge took his K-22B Bird of Prey Class Scout into Federation space at this time. Presumably, Kruge learned about Project Genesis before entering Federation Space. There may be a connection between Kruge's mission and the disappearance of a deep-space freighter, also taking place at this time.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Admiral Randolph Morrow informs all Starfleet vessels that: "According to information obtained by the highest levels of Starfleet Command, the race of energy beings referred to as the Organians have ceased their enforcement of the Organian Peace Treaty." Apparently, the Organians will no longer intervene in any actions between the Federation and the Klingon Empire. This means that war is once again possible.

gsx$event.$t: Admiral Randolph Morrow informs all Starfleet vessels that: "According to information obtained by the highest levels of Starfleet Command, the race of energy beings referred to as the Organians have ceased their enforcement of the Organian Peace Treaty." Apparently, the Organians will no longer intervene in any actions between the Federation and the Klingon Empire. This means that war is once again possible.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Tellarite Captain Jarv Gouthar is promoted to Commodore and reassigned to serve as Assistant Base Commander at Star Base 14.

gsx$event.$t: Tellarite Captain Jarv Gouthar is promoted to Commodore and reassigned to serve as Assistant Base Commander at Star Base 14.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: A settlement on Paxton IV's moon is destroyed, threatening interplanetary war between Paxton Ill and Paxton IV within the Triangle.

gsx$event.$t: A settlement on Paxton IV's moon is destroyed, threatening interplanetary war between Paxton Ill and Paxton IV within the Triangle.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Falsified stock certificates from major Tellarite corporations appear on several worlds near the UFP/Romulan border. Starfleet believes that these certificates are Orion forgeries, intended to destabilize the firms involved.

gsx$event.$t: Falsified stock certificates from major Tellarite corporations appear on several worlds near the UFP/Romulan border. Starfleet believes that these certificates are Orion forgeries, intended to destabilize the firms involved.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Starfleet Command begins making preparations for a Federation Galactic Conference.

gsx$event.$t: Starfleet Command begins making preparations for a Federation Galactic Conference.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: News of the Dixie Princess' destruction reaches the Dixie Lady. The ship sends a message to Star Base 12, but only a portion of it gets past Klingon jamming. This is the last transmission by an Operation Dixie starship.

gsx$event.$t: News of the Dixie Princess' destruction reaches the Dixie Lady. The ship sends a message to Star Base 12, but only a portion of it gets past Klingon jamming. This is the last transmission by an Operation Dixie starship.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Commodore Antonia Niccomachi, former Commander of Star Base 23, is transferred to Starfleet Intelligence Command. Commodore Georgi X. Ilanenko, former Assistant Commander of Star Base 22, replaces her.

gsx$event.$t: Commodore Antonia Niccomachi, former Commander of Star Base 23, is transferred to Starfleet Intelligence Command. Commodore Georgi X. Ilanenko, former Assistant Commander of Star Base 22, replaces her.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The USS Reliant, under the command of Captain Clark Terrell, is assigned to Project Genesis. The crew's mission is to locate a suitably lifeless planet for the projects first full-Scale test.

gsx$event.$t: The USS Reliant, under the command of Captain Clark Terrell, is assigned to Project Genesis. The crew's mission is to locate a suitably lifeless planet for the projects first full-Scale test.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Starfleet Intelligence later learns that the Klingon Subaiesh line and related allies have begun their ascent to power within the Klingon Diplomatic Corps.

gsx$event.$t: Starfleet Intelligence later learns that the Klingon Subaiesh line and related allies have begun their ascent to power within the Klingon Diplomatic Corps.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Beacuse of Admiral Dean Vanderhoff's illness, Commodore Gouthar replaces him as Commander of Star Base 14.

gsx$event.$t: Beacuse of Admiral Dean Vanderhoff's illness, Commodore Gouthar replaces him as Commander of Star Base 14.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Work continues very slowly on the Operation Armageddon simulation. The failure of Operation Dixie, the transfer of high-level Starfleet officers, the Galactic Conference, and the increasing presence of Klingon military activity all lead to a general cut-back in training projects in favor of 'real' military spending.

gsx$event.$t: Work continues very slowly on the Operation Armageddon simulation. The failure of Operation Dixie, the transfer of high-level Starfleet officers, the Galactic Conference, and the increasing presence of Klingon military activity all lead to a general cut-back in training projects in favor of 'real' military spending.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: A Klingon negotiation team is sent to the Federation with orders to discuss conditions for improving interstellar relations between the respective governments.

gsx$event.$t: A Klingon negotiation team is sent to the Federation with orders to discuss conditions for improving interstellar relations between the respective governments.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: After ten months of labor, the Starfleet Corps of Engineers complete their work on Regula.

gsx$event.$t: After ten months of labor, the Starfleet Corps of Engineers complete their work on Regula.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Numerous Starfleet vessels are reassigned to duty as dignitary couriers for the Galactic Conference.

gsx$event.$t: Numerous Starfleet vessels are reassigned to duty as dignitary couriers for the Galactic Conference.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The commander of the USS Zirconian Star, a transport, reports the theft of a warpshuttle and a large quantity of unrefined kironide from Platonius.

gsx$event.$t: The commander of the USS Zirconian Star, a transport, reports the theft of a warpshuttle and a large quantity of unrefined kironide from Platonius.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Office of Starfleet Research and Exploration join forces with the Starfleet Engineering Command to plan a series of starships utilizing the transwarp drive, including the Excelsior Class battleship and the Galaxy Class explorer. Architects and research crews begin work on three vessels: the USS Andromeda, the USS M-31, and the USS Magellanic Clouds, informally called the Magellan. However, the ships will not be operational for sometime.

gsx$event.$t: The Office of Starfleet Research and Exploration join forces with the Starfleet Engineering Command to plan a series of starships utilizing the transwarp drive, including the Excelsior Class battleship and the Galaxy Class explorer. Architects and research crews begin work on three vessels: the USS Andromeda, the USS M-31, and the USS Magellanic Clouds, informally called the Magellan. However, the ships will not be operational for sometime.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Now complete, Project Grey Ghost is considered an unqualified success. Starfleet gains important new information on the Romulan Star Empire.

gsx$event.$t: Now complete, Project Grey Ghost is considered an unqualified success. Starfleet gains important new information on the Romulan Star Empire.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Dixie scandal begins to rock Starfleet. Admiral Cartwright replaces Admiral Nogura, and Admiral Kirk (a protege of Nogura's) is transferred to Starfleet Education and Training Command. Many other officers retire, or are discharged or transferred.

gsx$event.$t: The Dixie scandal begins to rock Starfleet. Admiral Cartwright replaces Admiral Nogura, and Admiral Kirk (a protege of Nogura's) is transferred to Starfleet Education and Training Command. Many other officers retire, or are discharged or transferred.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: An Investigation Board examining records on Operation Dixie concludes that it probably failed because of a Klingon double agent.

gsx$event.$t: An Investigation Board examining records on Operation Dixie concludes that it probably failed because of a Klingon double agent.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The crew of the USS Reliant investigates Ceti Alpha V, believing it to be Ceti Alpha VI.

gsx$event.$t: The crew of the USS Reliant investigates Ceti Alpha V, believing it to be Ceti Alpha VI.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Commander Pavel Chekov and Captain Clark Terrell unexpectedly encounter Khan Noonian Singh on Ceti Alpha V. Khan imprisons them, and then uses Ceti eels to control their minds. Using the officers as bait, Khan and the rest of the Ceti Alpha survivors capture the research cruiser USS Reliant, and abandon most of the starships complement on Ceti Alpha V.

gsx$event.$t: Commander Pavel Chekov and Captain Clark Terrell unexpectedly encounter Khan Noonian Singh on Ceti Alpha V. Khan imprisons them, and then uses Ceti eels to control their minds. Using the officers as bait, Khan and the rest of the Ceti Alpha survivors capture the research cruiser USS Reliant, and abandon most of the starships complement on Ceti Alpha V.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Chekov notifies Doctor Marcus that the USS Reliant is on its way to Regula I to confiscate all Project Genesis materials and data.

gsx$event.$t: Chekov notifies Doctor Marcus that the USS Reliant is on its way to Regula I to confiscate all Project Genesis materials and data.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Admiral James Kirk joins Captain Spock aboard the USS Enterprise for a three-week Starfleet Academy cadet training cruise and inspection. Kirk receives a message, from Doctor Marcus regarding the confiscation of Projects Genesis. With Spock's cooperation, he resumes command of the Enterprise, and sets course for Regula.

gsx$event.$t: Admiral James Kirk joins Captain Spock aboard the USS Enterprise for a three-week Starfleet Academy cadet training cruise and inspection. Kirk receives a message, from Doctor Marcus regarding the confiscation of Projects Genesis. With Spock's cooperation, he resumes command of the Enterprise, and sets course for Regula.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Ambassador Sarek of Vulcan leaves Terra,to attend the Galactic Conference.

gsx$event.$t: Ambassador Sarek of Vulcan leaves Terra,to attend the Galactic Conference.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The USS Reliant arrives at Spacelab Regula I. Khan tortures and kills all Project Genesis personnel except Doctors Carol and David Marcus, who have transported to the Genesis cave on Regula.

gsx$event.$t: The USS Reliant arrives at Spacelab Regula I. Khan tortures and kills all Project Genesis personnel except Doctors Carol and David Marcus, who have transported to the Genesis cave on Regula.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The USS Reliant ambushes the USS Enterprise near Regula I and both vessels suffer damage in the tle. The Reliant disengages, and the Enterprise arrives Regula I to discover the fate of its staff.

gsx$event.$t: The USS Reliant ambushes the USS Enterprise near Regula I and both vessels suffer damage in the tle. The Reliant disengages, and the Enterprise arrives Regula I to discover the fate of its staff.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Enterprise pursues the Reliant to the Mutara Nebula, and the battle continues, killing Khan and severely damaging the Enterprise. Faced with the impending detonation of the Genesis Device, Spock enters a deadly radiation-contaminated area and restores power to the warp drive just in time to allow the Enterprise to outrun the Genesis Wave. In so doing, Spock absorbs a fatal dose of radiation. His inert body is launched in a photon torpedo toward the world where the Genesis Device is taking effect.

gsx$event.$t: The Enterprise pursues the Reliant to the Mutara Nebula, and the battle continues, killing Khan and severely damaging the Enterprise. Faced with the impending detonation of the Genesis Device, Spock enters a deadly radiation-contaminated area and restores power to the warp drive just in time to allow the Enterprise to outrun the Genesis Wave. In so doing, Spock absorbs a fatal dose of radiation. His inert body is launched in a photon torpedo toward the world where the Genesis Device is taking effect.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Lieutenant Saavik is given a Starfleet Commendation and afield promotion to full Lieutenant.

gsx$event.$t: Lieutenant Saavik is given a Starfleet Commendation and afield promotion to full Lieutenant.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: On its way back to Spacedock, the Enterprise rendezvous with the USS Firenze, a medical ship, to drop off Doctor Carol Marcus and most of the Academy cadets for further treatment and/or debriefing. Doctor David Marcus and Lieutenant Saavik are transferred to the Gagarin Class research vessel USS Grissom (NCC-639), which is on its way to survey the Genesis Planet. Starfleet Command dispatches a transport to pick up survivors of the USS Reliant, stranded on Ceti Alpha V.

gsx$event.$t: On its way back to Spacedock, the Enterprise rendezvous with the USS Firenze, a medical ship, to drop off Doctor Carol Marcus and most of the Academy cadets for further treatment and/or debriefing. Doctor David Marcus and Lieutenant Saavik are transferred to the Gagarin Class research vessel USS Grissom (NCC-639), which is on its way to survey the Genesis Planet. Starfleet Command dispatches a transport to pick up survivors of the USS Reliant, stranded on Ceti Alpha V.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Admiral Vanderhoff accepts a medical retirement, and Commodore Gouthar formally replaces him as Commander of Star Base 14, a duty he has already assumed.

gsx$event.$t: Admiral Vanderhoff accepts a medical retirement, and Commodore Gouthar formally replaces him as Commander of Star Base 14, a duty he has already assumed.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Enterprise returns to Spacedock at Terra, and Starfleet Admiral Morrow meets with some of the Enterprise crew. He explains that, by order of the Federation Council, the Genesis Project is not to be discussed and no starship except the Grissom is allowed to travel in the Mutara Sector.

gsx$event.$t: The Enterprise returns to Spacedock at Terra, and Starfleet Admiral Morrow meets with some of the Enterprise crew. He explains that, by order of the Federation Council, the Genesis Project is not to be discussed and no starship except the Grissom is allowed to travel in the Mutara Sector.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: In disfavor due to the loss of the Reliant, the Regula I Research Station, the Genesis Device, and Spock, Kirk meets with Sarek, Spock's father. The demoralized Enterprise crew is reassigned to various posts on Terra and at the Spacedock, pending further investigation. Sarek immediately leaves for Vulcan after arranging transportation for Commander Uhura to Vulcan.

gsx$event.$t: In disfavor due to the loss of the Reliant, the Regula I Research Station, the Genesis Device, and Spock, Kirk meets with Sarek, Spock's father. The demoralized Enterprise crew is reassigned to various posts on Terra and at the Spacedock, pending further investigation. Sarek immediately leaves for Vulcan after arranging transportation for Commander Uhura to Vulcan.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The USS Grissom, under the command of Captain J.T. Esteban, arrives at the Genesis Planet. Doctor David Marcus and Lieutenant Saavik beam down and find a Vulcan baby, who is growing up at a highly accelerated rate. This proves to be the regenerated body of Spock, but minus his intellect and essence.

gsx$event.$t: The USS Grissom, under the command of Captain J.T. Esteban, arrives at the Genesis Planet. Doctor David Marcus and Lieutenant Saavik beam down and find a Vulcan baby, who is growing up at a highly accelerated rate. This proves to be the regenerated body of Spock, but minus his intellect and essence.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Admiral Kirk unsuccessfully tries to convince Admiral orrow to let him return to the Genesis Planet. While under surveillance, Doctor McCoy is observed discussing Genesis in public, and is arrested and confined to a security holding area.

gsx$event.$t: Admiral Kirk unsuccessfully tries to convince Admiral orrow to let him return to the Genesis Planet. While under surveillance, Doctor McCoy is observed discussing Genesis in public, and is arrested and confined to a security holding area.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Captain Lawrence Stiles of the USS Excelsior declares that his vessel is ready for trials.

gsx$event.$t: Captain Lawrence Stiles of the USS Excelsior declares that his vessel is ready for trials.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: While Admiral Kirk and Commander Sulu free Doctor McCoy from a security holding area, Commander Scott sabotages the USS Excelsiors transwarp drive computer. With the help of Uhura, Kirk, McCoy, Scott, Sulu, and Chekov steal the Enterprise from Spacedock and travel to the Genesis Planet to seek Spock's body. Uhura immediately leaves for Vulcan.

gsx$event.$t: While Admiral Kirk and Commander Sulu free Doctor McCoy from a security holding area, Commander Scott sabotages the USS Excelsiors transwarp drive computer. With the help of Uhura, Kirk, McCoy, Scott, Sulu, and Chekov steal the Enterprise from Spacedock and travel to the Genesis Planet to seek Spock's body. Uhura immediately leaves for Vulcan.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Klingon Captain Kruge, commanding a cloaking device-equipped K-22B Bird of Prey Class scout, destroy the Gagarin Class USS Grissom and all aboard her. Doctor David Marcus, Lieutenant Saavik, and a partially regenerated Spock, all on the surface of the Genesis Planet, survive.

gsx$event.$t: Klingon Captain Kruge, commanding a cloaking device-equipped K-22B Bird of Prey Class scout, destroy the Gagarin Class USS Grissom and all aboard her. Doctor David Marcus, Lieutenant Saavik, and a partially regenerated Spock, all on the surface of the Genesis Planet, survive.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Starfleet Command and the Enterprise both fail to establish contact with the Grissom.

gsx$event.$t: Starfleet Command and the Enterprise both fail to establish contact with the Grissom.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: A landing party of several Klingons beams down to the Genesis Planet. Upon reaching the planet, the Enterprise discovers that the Grissom has been destroyed. The Enterprise exchanges fire with the Klingon Scout, but cannot finish it off.

gsx$event.$t: A landing party of several Klingons beams down to the Genesis Planet. Upon reaching the planet, the Enterprise discovers that the Grissom has been destroyed. The Enterprise exchanges fire with the Klingon Scout, but cannot finish it off.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: In response, a Klingon kills Doctor David Marcus on the Genesis Planet. Admiral Kirk tricks Captain Kruge into sending a boarding party onto the Enterprise, then self-destructs the ship. Kirk kills Kruge on the planet.

gsx$event.$t: In response, a Klingon kills Doctor David Marcus on the Genesis Planet. Admiral Kirk tricks Captain Kruge into sending a boarding party onto the Enterprise, then self-destructs the ship. Kirk kills Kruge on the planet.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Kirk, Sulu, Saavik, McCoy, Chekov, and Scott escape aboard the Klingon Scout with the regenerated Spock. Maltz, the Bird of Prey's First Officer, is also taken into custody. The Genesis Effect proves its instability, and the Genesis Planet disintegrates.

gsx$event.$t: Kirk, Sulu, Saavik, McCoy, Chekov, and Scott escape aboard the Klingon Scout with the regenerated Spock. Maltz, the Bird of Prey's First Officer, is also taken into custody. The Genesis Effect proves its instability, and the Genesis Planet disintegrates.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Bird of Prey lands on Vulcan. Spock's intellect is restored by the Vulcan ritual of fal tor pan, transferring Spock's essence, which he placed in McCoy just before exposing himself to the radiation, back into his own body.

gsx$event.$t: The Bird of Prey lands on Vulcan. Spock's intellect is restored by the Vulcan ritual of fal tor pan, transferring Spock's essence, which he placed in McCoy just before exposing himself to the radiation, back into his own body.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Admiral Randolph Morrow files an affidavit containing his personal evaluation of Admiral Kirks recent actions.

gsx$event.$t: Admiral Randolph Morrow files an affidavit containing his personal evaluation of Admiral Kirks recent actions.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: An unmanned Federation convoy operating within the Organian Neutral Zone is destroyed. Evidence later points to a Klingon attack.

gsx$event.$t: An unmanned Federation convoy operating within the Organian Neutral Zone is destroyed. Evidence later points to a Klingon attack.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Starfleet Intelligence Command sends the Northampton Class frigate USS Bremerton into the Triangle on "business of an undisclosed nature".

gsx$event.$t: Starfleet Intelligence Command sends the Northampton Class frigate USS Bremerton into the Triangle on "business of an undisclosed nature".

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Federation Security Council holds the first in a series of closed meetings to investigate security leaks surrounding Project Genesis. Several theories are discussed, but the Council's findings conclude that the UFP may never know for sure how the Klingons learned about this project.

gsx$event.$t: The Federation Security Council holds the first in a series of closed meetings to investigate security leaks surrounding Project Genesis. Several theories are discussed, but the Council's findings conclude that the UFP may never know for sure how the Klingons learned about this project.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Starfleet Security Command publishes a report examining how Admiral Kirk was able to spacejack a starship from Spacedock. The report also suggests numerous procedural changes to improve security and to prevent a repeat occurrence.

gsx$event.$t: Starfleet Security Command publishes a report examining how Admiral Kirk was able to spacejack a starship from Spacedock. The report also suggests numerous procedural changes to improve security and to prevent a repeat occurrence.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: An unidentified alien, faster-than-light spacecraft is detected in deep space. Over the next two weeks, the ship rapidly continues on its course toward Terra.

gsx$event.$t: An unidentified alien, faster-than-light spacecraft is detected in deep space. Over the next two weeks, the ship rapidly continues on its course toward Terra.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: A computer failure on Star Base 10 destroys many Starfleet Intelligence Command personnel files related to Operation Dixie.

gsx$event.$t: A computer failure on Star Base 10 destroys many Starfleet Intelligence Command personnel files related to Operation Dixie.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Kiltarc zantai-Neygebh, Klingon Ambassador to the UFP, arrives on Terra. He meets with a select committee of Federation Councilmembers, ranking Starfleet officials, and Federation Supreme Court Justices. This visiting dignitary describes Admiral James T. Kirk, in his role in the Genesis Project, as a pirate and interstellar criminal who has recklessly endangered peace in known space. Kiltarc also insists that Kirk be turned over to the Klingon Diplomatic Corps to stand trial in the Klingon Empire for his crimes. The Federation Council President responds that if Kirk is going to stand trial anywhere, he will do so within the Federation and under Federation jurisprudence. At the moment, however, Kirk is immune to prosecution while receiving political asylum from Ambassador Sarek.

gsx$event.$t: Kiltarc zantai-Neygebh, Klingon Ambassador to the UFP, arrives on Terra. He meets with a select committee of Federation Councilmembers, ranking Starfleet officials, and Federation Supreme Court Justices. This visiting dignitary describes Admiral James T. Kirk, in his role in the Genesis Project, as a pirate and interstellar criminal who has recklessly endangered peace in known space. Kiltarc also insists that Kirk be turned over to the Klingon Diplomatic Corps to stand trial in the Klingon Empire for his crimes. The Federation Council President responds that if Kirk is going to stand trial anywhere, he will do so within the Federation and under Federation jurisprudence. At the moment, however, Kirk is immune to prosecution while receiving political asylum from Ambassador Sarek.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Admiral Kirk and his party leave in the Klingon Bird of Prey for Terra, where all (except Spock) face courts-martial for the theft and destruction of the USS Enterprise. By this time, both Captain Spock and Doctor McCoy have recovered fully from the fal tor pan process.

gsx$event.$t: Admiral Kirk and his party leave in the Klingon Bird of Prey for Terra, where all (except Spock) face courts-martial for the theft and destruction of the USS Enterprise. By this time, both Captain Spock and Doctor McCoy have recovered fully from the fal tor pan process.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The alien spacecraft reaches Terra, neutralizing any starship that impedes its progress. Though still unidentified, the vessel makes its intentions partially known upon arrival. It is attempting to establish meaningful communication with an intelligent species of life that is now extinct on Terra - belonging to the order Cetacea, suborder Mysticeti, specifically, the humpback whale.

gsx$event.$t: The alien spacecraft reaches Terra, neutralizing any starship that impedes its progress. Though still unidentified, the vessel makes its intentions partially known upon arrival. It is attempting to establish meaningful communication with an intelligent species of life that is now extinct on Terra - belonging to the order Cetacea, suborder Mysticeti, specifically, the humpback whale.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Upon failing to establish communication, the spacecraft begins heating up the planets atmosphere, altering Terras ecological balance. If action is not taken soon the effect will be irreversible and catastrophic, rendering the entire planet lifeless.

gsx$event.$t: Upon failing to establish communication, the spacecraft begins heating up the planets atmosphere, altering Terras ecological balance. If action is not taken soon the effect will be irreversible and catastrophic, rendering the entire planet lifeless.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Alistair Fergus, President of the Federation Council, sends out an urgent message describing the situation on Terra, and ordering all starships and beings to stay away from the planet. Admiral Kirk's party aboard the Bird of Prey receives the message and formulates a plan of action.

gsx$event.$t: Alistair Fergus, President of the Federation Council, sends out an urgent message describing the situation on Terra, and ordering all starships and beings to stay away from the planet. Admiral Kirk's party aboard the Bird of Prey receives the message and formulates a plan of action.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: By using Sols gravitational field in a breakaway-slingshot maneuver, Admiral Kirks Bird of Prey goes back into time to approximately Stardate -1/8608. (The Enterprise used the same method to travel accidentally to Stardate -1/6701.26, when it was reported by Captain John Christopher, USAF, as an unidentified flying object.)

gsx$event.$t: By using Sols gravitational field in a breakaway-slingshot maneuver, Admiral Kirks Bird of Prey goes back into time to approximately Stardate -1/8608. (The Enterprise used the same method to travel accidentally to Stardate -1/6701.26, when it was reported by Captain John Christopher, USAF, as an unidentified flying object.)

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: After retrieving two humpback whales from the past, the Bird of Prey returns to the present and crash lands into San Francisco Bay, releasing the animals. The alien ship establishes communication and reverses the warming effects, returning Terra to its former condition. Kirk and his party are taken into custody.

gsx$event.$t: After retrieving two humpback whales from the past, the Bird of Prey returns to the present and crash lands into San Francisco Bay, releasing the animals. The alien ship establishes communication and reverses the warming effects, returning Terra to its former condition. Kirk and his party are taken into custody.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: After extensive interrogation and cross-examination, A the courts-martial of everyone involved in the Enterprise theft are now complete. It is the Court's decision that Scott, Sulu, Uhura, McCoy, and Chekov were only following the orders of Admiral Kirk. For this reason, they will not be imprisoned, demoted, or penalized in any way.

gsx$event.$t: After extensive interrogation and cross-examination, A the courts-martial of everyone involved in the Enterprise theft are now complete. It is the Court's decision that Scott, Sulu, Uhura, McCoy, and Chekov were only following the orders of Admiral Kirk. For this reason, they will not be imprisoned, demoted, or penalized in any way.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Court rules that Admiral James T. Kirk, acting from a sense of loyalty and duty, was still personally responsible for the spacejacking and subsequent destruction of the USS Enterprise. However, his actions also led to the capture of a Klingon warship, the successful recovery of Captain Spock, and the resolution of the Cetacean Incident. For this reason, the Court sentences Kirk to formal chastisement and a two-grade demotion to Captain. Clearly, Captain Kirk will no longer have a place on the Admiralty Staff, and so he must return to a field assignment as a starship Commander.

gsx$event.$t: The Court rules that Admiral James T. Kirk, acting from a sense of loyalty and duty, was still personally responsible for the spacejacking and subsequent destruction of the USS Enterprise. However, his actions also led to the capture of a Klingon warship, the successful recovery of Captain Spock, and the resolution of the Cetacean Incident. For this reason, the Court sentences Kirk to formal chastisement and a two-grade demotion to Captain. Clearly, Captain Kirk will no longer have a place on the Admiralty Staff, and so he must return to a field assignment as a starship Commander.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Starfleet Command's Naval Construction Contract Number 1786, under construction at Sol III, reaches completion. Although this Enterprise Class Mk III cruiser was to be christened the USS Atlantis, it will instead be designated NCC 1701-A, and christened the (new) USS Enterprise in honor of Captain Kirk.

gsx$event.$t: Starfleet Command's Naval Construction Contract Number 1786, under construction at Sol III, reaches completion. Although this Enterprise Class Mk III cruiser was to be christened the USS Atlantis, it will instead be designated NCC 1701-A, and christened the (new) USS Enterprise in honor of Captain Kirk.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Klingon Ambassador Kiltarc abruptly leaves Terra and returns to the Klingon Empire.

gsx$event.$t: Klingon Ambassador Kiltarc abruptly leaves Terra and returns to the Klingon Empire.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Starfleet Command's USS Excelsior, the first Mk I battleship of the class, is commissioned. However, an assortment of malfunctions and minor systems defects continue to keep the vessel from being deployed in an active role.

gsx$event.$t: Starfleet Command's USS Excelsior, the first Mk I battleship of the class, is commissioned. However, an assortment of malfunctions and minor systems defects continue to keep the vessel from being deployed in an active role.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Nelson Class scout USS Fremont is sighted in the Triangle. Klingons captured this vessel during the Four Years War, and have been using it in the Imperial Klingon Navy ever since. It is believed that the entire ship has been refitted with Klingon equipment.

gsx$event.$t: The Nelson Class scout USS Fremont is sighted in the Triangle. Klingons captured this vessel during the Four Years War, and have been using it in the Imperial Klingon Navy ever since. It is believed that the entire ship has been refitted with Klingon equipment.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Imperial Klingon States' IKSV Staav'eMara is sighted in the Triangle. This Loknar Class frigate was captured during the Four Years War, used in an attempted Klingon political coup, and then entered service within the Triangle.

gsx$event.$t: The Imperial Klingon States' IKSV Staav'eMara is sighted in the Triangle. This Loknar Class frigate was captured during the Four Years War, used in an attempted Klingon political coup, and then entered service within the Triangle.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: While at port in a repair facility, the Reliant Class research cruiser USS Accommodator (NCC-26256) is rammed by the Liberty Class freighter John B. Goodings. The colliSion causes excessive external damage and uncontrollable internal fires aboard the cruiser. Allowed to burn itself out in a safe location, the Accommodator is boarded, evaluated, and then scrapped.

gsx$event.$t: While at port in a repair facility, the Reliant Class research cruiser USS Accommodator (NCC-26256) is rammed by the Liberty Class freighter John B. Goodings. The colliSion causes excessive external damage and uncontrollable internal fires aboard the cruiser. Allowed to burn itself out in a safe location, the Accommodator is boarded, evaluated, and then scrapped.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Starfleet Commands USS Columbia, the first Excelsior Mk II Class battleship, is completed and begins trials. It is to be commissioned sometime in early 2/24.

gsx$event.$t: Starfleet Commands USS Columbia, the first Excelsior Mk II Class battleship, is completed and begins trials. It is to be commissioned sometime in early 2/24.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Orion colony on the moon of Rockhaven within the Triangle is destroyed. Evidence points to factious members of the Orion freebooters.

gsx$event.$t: The Orion colony on the moon of Rockhaven within the Triangle is destroyed. Evidence points to factious members of the Orion freebooters.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Northampton Class USS Bremerton returns to Star Base 10, completing its one-year mission. Details remain classified at this time.

gsx$event.$t: The Northampton Class USS Bremerton returns to Star Base 10, completing its one-year mission. Details remain classified at this time.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The High Rider, a chartered pleasure vessel, is lost near Star Base 27.

gsx$event.$t: The High Rider, a chartered pleasure vessel, is lost near Star Base 27.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Starfleet Command's USS Proxima, the second Excelsior Mk I Class battleship, is completed and begins trials. It is to be commissioned sometime in early 2/24.

gsx$event.$t: Starfleet Command's USS Proxima, the second Excelsior Mk I Class battleship, is completed and begins trials. It is to be commissioned sometime in early 2/24.
